title: Thunderbird won't download messages from one of my email addresses
creator: moreta56
content: My Thunderbird hasn't downloaded emails to my main/default address since mid January. The other two addresses, with all the same settings, and with the same provider, work. Emails are goint to my web mail. I've spent hours on support and on remote control with my provider, and they finally said maybe it's a thunderbird problem. I deleted the programme and reinstalled it, still won't download and all the emails are still missing from my inbox. The emails went missing when I attempted to repair the folders earlier in the saga.. All my local folders are there. I may have to start all over again from a new programme. Thank goodness I can access all emails from my provider's web portal. Aussiebroadband.

title: Trash and junk
creator: vanriet.jp
content:
Waarom zijn er in de samengevoegde accounts geen mappen "prullenbak en junk" voorzien. Dit zou heel makkelijk zijn, omdat je niet steeds naar de apparte accounts moet gaan om alles te verwijderen.

Bij Bluemail is dit wel en ik vond dat heel makkelijk.

Mvg J-P 

Why are there no "trash and junk" folders provided in the merged accounts.

This would be very easy because you don't have to go to the separate accounts all the time to delete everything.

At Bluemail this is and I found that very easy.

Grtz J-P

title: SMTP configuration for GMX
creator: rg.alix
content:
Hello,

I'm trying to setup a new GMX email address in Thunderbird. I can receive messages, but when I try sending an email, I get stuck on the loading bar "sending message". I receive no error message.

I have multiple GMX addresses in Thunderbird already, all work well for receiving and sending emails. I tried writing to email addresses with different providers, the result is always the same.

I tried adding the IMAP info manually and automatically in Thunderbird, nothing changes. Here is my current SMTP server :

mail.gmx.com Port 465 SSL/TLS Normal password

Can someone please help me figure out this SMTP setup ?

Thanks ! Alix

title: Mozilla's e-mail address for reporting code of conduct violations is not accepting e-mails
creator: antifascist
content:
Hello, can someone please fix this e-mail address please & thank you.

Following the instructions provided at this web page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Community/Community_Participation_Guidelines I e-mailed a code of conduct violation report to the provided email address, mdn-cpg-report@mozilla.com

Actual results:

I immediately received the following e-mail reply, telling me in effect that my e-mail could not be delivered:

Forwarded Message --------

Subject: Delivery Status Notification (Failure) Date: Sun, 15 Feb 2026 21:34:30 -0800 (PST) From: Mail Delivery Subsystem <mailer-daemon@googlemail.com> To: [redacted]

Hello [redacted],

We're writing to let you know that the group you tried to contact (mdn-cpg-report) may not exist, or you may not have permission to post messages to the group. A few more details on why you weren't able to post:

You might have spelled or formatted the group name incorrectly. The owner of the group may have removed this group. You may need to join the group before receiving permission to post. This group may not be open to posting. If you have questions related to this or any other Google Group, visit the Help Center at https://support.google.com/a/mozilla.com/bin/topic.py?topic=25838.

Thanks,

mozilla.com admins

Original message -----

[headers, etc redacted]

Expected results:

I expected instead to receive a reply telling me that my e-mail had been successfully received.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10

title: Why Professional Construction Project Management Is Essential for Project Success
creator: junipereva631
content:
Managing a construction project involves much more than just supervising labor on-site. From budgeting and scheduling to procurement and risk control, every stage requires careful planning and coordination. That’s why Professional Construction Project Management plays a crucial role in delivering projects on time and within budget.

With experienced project managers, contractors can streamline communication between architects, engineers, and subcontractors while minimizing costly delays and errors. Proper documentation, accurate cost tracking, and proactive risk management ensure smoother execution from start to finish.

In today’s competitive construction industry, investing in professional management services is not just an option it’s a smart strategy for achieving quality results and long-term success. Visit website: https://aaaestimating.com/our-services/construction-management-services/

title: Data Protection on a Shared Computer
creator: juergen
content:
Dear all,

I would like to use Thunderbird on a shared computer at my universitys lab space (it is mainly my PC but other people have access and use it sometimes). However, as we are requested to keep mails confidential I thought it would be as easy as just setting a primary password and thunderbird would not start if that password is not set. However, that proofed to be a wrong assumption. Instead if I just cancel the dialog it will open and still display all the locally stored mails.

We are using IMAP server and I already set up that the mails are not stored locally. Still, some mails that I have used recently are visible. I am aware that there would anyway be the local copy in the profile folder but I guess none of the people sharing that computer would take the efford to check that, so I would be fine if I could simply prevent thunderbird from starting without the primary password.

Is there any option for that or any extention that would do so?

Thank you in advance! Juergen
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:147.0.2;os:Windows 10;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/primary-password-replacing-master-password-thunderbird"]

I've tried changing the format of new emails between HTML and Plain Text and nothing seems to overcome this issue.

title: almost all mails in sub folders of inbox have disappeared
creator: Frank207
content: I am really in a panic: Using ubuntu 22.04 and Thunderbird 140.7.1.esr For my main account I keep some 40 sub-folders and sub-sub-folders. All but the most recent mails in my sub folders are gone, something like 4 years of email. I asked chatGPT for help and found inside the /mail folder that most of the files with the names of my sub folders with no extension have 0 kb. I don't use IMAPS because I wanted my mails on my computer so I use only POP. :-( The interesting thing is that this only happend to my main account. I have 6 more accounts in Thunderbird and they seem to be fine, at least for now. Thank you for any help. Kind regards Frank
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/142.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;tb_version:140.7.1esr;os:Linux

title: Outgoing messages refuse to send with thunderbird
creator: christianroche12
content:
Hello, I only use Thunderbird on my PC with IMAP. For the past three days, while I receive my emails just fine, I can no longer send them. They bounce back with the following error message:

The only thing I've done is also install Thunderbird on my mobile phone. It asked me for a password that I don't know and don't think I've ever had one for Thunderbird.

However, when I go directly to the Free Zimbra website associated with my email, it works and I can send my emails. Thank you for your help.

Christian - Error message attached.
